result.execSummary:
The defendant Freeman R Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.
Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.

Need PICTURE AND PRINTS.  
DNA sample has already been given.

records.addlTxt: Given in Court

Atty White appears for the State.  Defendant Freeman Peters appears with Atty Bartholomew. Plea questionaire and waiver of rights signed by the defendant.  Court gives defendant his rights. No contest plea entered.  Court finds defendant guilty. Court pronounces sentence.
DNA proof of submission - original
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-13-2016 03:30 pm
Pre-trial conference at 10-30-2015 02:15 pm
Pre-trial conference at 09-25-2015 10:30 am
#1, 2 and 3 photos
Pre-trial conference at 07-24-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Freeman R Peters in court with attorney John Scott Bartholomew.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Witness, bartender sworn in and testifies.  Witness identifies the defendant.  Exhibit #1 photo of victim introduced.  Cross exam by Atty Bartholomew.  Witness draws on chalkboard diagram and describes what he saw.  Officer sworn in and testifies.  Exhibit 1, 2 and 3 photos of victim TM intoduced to the court.  Objection; hearsay.  Overruled it's a preliminary hearing.  Ex #4 statement of victim introduced.  Cross exam.  Nurse practitioner at ER expert witness for medical issues sworn in and testifies to 3 stitches to eye, 10 staples to head.  No cross exam.  Exhibits 1, 2 and 3 admitted into evidence.  Closing by attorneys.  Probable cause found.  Bind over.  Defense stands mute.  Court enters not guilty plea.
Hearing Notice - hand delivered in courtroom

Defendant Freeman R Peters in court with attorney John Scott Bartholomew.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives reading of the complaint.  Defense waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.
John S. Bartholomew
Hearing Notice - hand delivered in courtroom

Defendant Freeman R Peters in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has filed taxes, but attorney would not appear without retainer paid.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
hand delivered
Defendant Freeman R Peters in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Has contacted Attorney Jack Bartholomew.  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Freeman R Peters in court, in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not obtained counsel.  Wrote letter to public defender.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
hand delivered

Defendant Freeman R Peters in court with Attorney Nathaniel J. Wojan.  Defendant Freeman R Peters in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Wojan informs the court of his clients wishes to obtain private counsel. Court questions Freeman Peters - court accepts the Def.'s waiver of time limits for his PH. Court allows Atty. Wojan to withdraw as counsel of record. STC set for 01-20-15 at 10am so the court can see if Freeman Peters has obtained new counsel.  Status conference scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
